intro: Psychotria loniceroides var. typica, commonly known as the "Coca plant" or "Yareta," is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a shrub that typically grows in high-altitude environments, often found in cloud forests and alpine tundras. The plant has elliptical, leathery leaves with a dark green color and produces small, white or greenish flowers. It is notable for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and withstand harsh climatic conditions. The species is also recognized for its ecological importance and traditional uses by indigenous communities.
